content:
Hi - I'm Sam! I'm a PhD student in the Pedersen Group at Edinburgh University. I work on trying to understand how ecological factors affect the spread of infectious disease. I'm currently focused on how changes in nutrition and resources can affect how animals utilise these resources and space through their environment, and how this changes their behaviour, how they interact, and how diseases spread through populations.
That may sound like a mouthful but I'm an ecologist at heart, passionate about all things natural. As well as ecology I'm interested in teaching and using statistical modelling in R as well as trying to work out how we can apply modern open-science practices to ecological research.
Find out more about me and my work below or get in touch!
